description: Single storey side/rear extension; extension of raised rear patio; installation of external staircase to patio; and external alterations
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with:
Location plan; 98-010 (Site plan), 98-210 (Existing elevations), 98-201 (Existing floor plans), 10-210 P01 (proposed elevations & section) & 10-201 P01 (Proposed floor plans)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounds, in accordance with polices 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (g) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy D4of the London Plan (2021)

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The boundary treatment flanking the terrace, as shown on drawing numbers: 10-201 (Rev. P01) and 10-210 (Rev. P01) shall be installed prior to first use of the extended terrace and retained in perpetuity.
Reason: To protect the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
